member.summary: Gets the component field's type

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Animation.AnimationChannel.DefaultValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the Default value of the channel. If a channel has no keyframe sequences connected, the default value will be used during the animation evaluation. A real scenario: Animation only animates a node's x coordinate, the y and z are not changed, then the default value will be used during full translation evaluation.

member.summary: Gets associated keyframe sequence inside this channel

member.summary: The key frame's interpolation type.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Animation.Interpolation.Constant
member.summary: The value will remains constant to the value of the first point until the next segment.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Animation.Interpolation.Linear
member.summary: Linear interpolation is a straight line between two points.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Animation.Interpolation.Bezier
member.summary: A bezier or Hermite spline.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Animation.Interpolation.BSpline
member.summary: Basis splines are defined by a series of control points, for which the curve is guaranteed only to go through the first and the last point.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Animation.Interpolation.CardinalSpline
member.summary: A cardinal spline is a cubic Hermite spline whose tangents are defined by the endpoints and a tension parameter.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Animation.Interpolation.TCBSpline
member.summary: Also called Kochanek-Bartels spline, the behavior of tangent is defined by tension/bias/continuity

member.summary: Weighted mode.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Animation.WeightedMode.None

member.summary: Out(right) tangent is weighted.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Animation.WeightedMode.NextInWeight
member.summary: Next in(left) tangent is weighted.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Animation.WeightedMode.Both
member.summary: Both out and next in tangents are weighted.

member.summary: Interpolation step mode.

member.summary: Curve value of a segment always uses the value from previous key frame

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Animation.StepMode.NextValue

Aspose.3D's supports animation hierarchy, each animation can be composed by several animations and animation's key-frame definition.
defines the transformation of a property value over time, for example, animation node can be used to control a node's transformation or other object's numerical properties.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Animation.KeyFrame
member.summary: A key frame is mainly defined by a time and a value, for some interpolation types, tangent/tension/bias/continuity is also used by calculating the final sampled value. Sampled values in a non-key-frame time position is interpolated by key-frames between the previous and next key-frames Value before/after the first/last key-frame are calculated by the class.

member.summary: Create a new key frame on specified curve
member.param: The curve that the key frame will be created on
The time position of the key frame

member.summary: Gets the string representation of the key frame

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Animation.KeyFrame.Time
member.summary: Gets or sets the time position of list.data[index] key frame, measured in seconds.

member.summary: Gets or sets the key-frame's value.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Animation.KeyFrame.Interpolation
member.summary: Gets or sets the key's interpolation type, list.data[index] defines the algorithm how the sampled value is calculated.

member.summary: Gets or sets the key's tangent weight mode. The out tangent or the next in tangent can be customized by select correct

member.summary: Gets or sets the key's step mode. If the interpolation type is , list.data[index] decides which key-frame's value will be used during interpolation. A means the left key-frame's value will be used A means the next right key-frame's value will be used

member.summary: Gets or sets the next in(left) tangent on this key frame.

member.summary: Gets or sets the out(right) tangent on this key frame.

member.summary: Get or set if the key frame is flat. Key frame should be flat if next or previous key frame has the same value. Flat key frame has flat tangents and fixed interpolation.

member.summary: Gets or sets the tangent is time-independent

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Deformers.BoneLinkMode
member.summary: A bone's link mode refers to the way in which a bone is connected or linked to its parent bone within a hierarchical structure.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Deformers.BoneLinkMode.Normalize
member.summary: In this mode, the transformations of child bones are normalized concerning their parent bone's transformations.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Deformers.BoneLinkMode.Additive
member.summary: Additive mode calculates the transformations of child bones by adding their own local transformations to those of their parent bones.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Deformers.BoneLinkMode.TotalOne
member.summary: Total One ensures that combined transformations of the parent and child bones result in a combined transformation that scales to an overall length of one unit.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Deformers.Bone
member.summary: A bone defines the subset of the geometry's control point, and defined blend weight for each control point. The object cannot be used directly, a instance is used to deform the geometry, and comes with a set of bones, each bone linked to a node. NOTE: A control point of a geometry can be bounded to more than one Bones.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Deformers.MorphTargetDeformer
member.summary: MorphTargetDeformer provides per-vertex animation. MorphTargetDeformer organize all targets via , each channel can organize multiple targets. A common use of morph target deformer is to apply facial expression to a character. More details can be found at https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Morph_target_animation

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Entities.Geometry
member.summary:
The base class of all renderable geometric objects (like , , and etc.).
The base class supports:
Control point management, control points defines the base 3D spatial structure of the geometry, different geometric types has different way to define concrete 3D models.
Vertex element definition, vertex elements applies extra information like normals/uv coordinates/vertex colors to the geometry, see for more details.
Object deforming, can be bonded to animate geometry's shape.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Entities.Light
member.summary:
The light illuminates the scene.
The formula to calculate the total attenuation of light is: A = ConstantAttenuation + (Dist * LinearAttenuation) + ((Dist^2) * QuadraticAttenuation)
member.seealso: Tutorial - Illuminate a box in a scene

member.summary: The data is mapped to the polygon. Each polygon vertex shares the same data when mapping mode is .

member.summary: The data is mapped to the edge. Each edge end point shares the same data when mapping is .

member.summary: One data mapped to the whole surface. What ever data is interpreted as control point/polygon vertex/edge endpoints, the data is always the same as it defined by .

A VertexElement describes how the vertex element is mapped to a geometry surface and how the mapping information is arranged in memory. A VertexElement contains Normals, UVs or other kind of information.

member.summary: Encoder will compress the scene optimally, which may takes longer time to finish.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.FbxSaveOptions.ReusePrimitiveMesh
member.summary: Reuse the mesh for the primitives with same parameters, this will significantly reduce the size of FBX output which scene was constructed by large set of primitive shapes(like imported from CAD files). Default value is false

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.FbxSaveOptions.EnableCompression
member.summary: Compression large binary data in the FBX file(e.g. animation data, control points, vertex element data, indices), default value is true.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.FbxSaveOptions.FoldRepeatedCurveData
member.summary: Gets or sets whether reuse repeated curve data by increasing last data's ref count
member.value: true if fold repeated curve data; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.FbxSaveOptions.ExportLegacyMaterialProperties
member.summary: Gets or sets whether export legacy material properties, used for back compatibility. This option is turned on by default.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.FbxSaveOptions.VideoForTexture
member.summary: Gets or sets whether generate a Video instance for when exporting as FBX.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.FbxSaveOptions.EmbedTextures
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to embed the texture to the final output file. FBX Exporter will try to find the texture's raw data from , and embed the file to final FBX file. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.FbxSaveOptions.GenerateVertexElementMaterial
member.summary: Gets or sets whether always generate a for geometries if the attached node contains materials. This is turned off by default.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GltfSaveOptions.PrettyPrint
member.summary: The JSON content of GLTF file is indented for human reading, default value is false

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GltfSaveOptions.FallbackNormal
member.summary: When GLTF2 exporter detected an invalid normal, this will be used instead of its original value to bypass the validation. Default value is (0, 1, 0)

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GltfSaveOptions.EmbedAssets
member.summary: Embed all external assets as base64 into single file in ASCII mode, default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GltfSaveOptions.ImageFormat
member.summary: Standard glTF only supports PNG/JPG as its texture format, this option will guide how Aspose.3D convert the non-standard images to supported format during the exporting. Default value is

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GltfSaveOptions.MaterialConverter
member.summary: Custom converter to convert the geometry's material to PBR material If this is unassigned, glTF 2.0 exporter will automatically convert the standard material to PBR material. Default value is null This property is used when exporting a scene to a glTF 2.0 file.
member.seealso: Tutorial - Custom material converter to convert Phong material to PBR material

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GltfSaveOptions.UseCommonMaterials
member.summary: Serialize materials using KHR common material extensions, default value is false. Set this to false will cause Aspose.3D export a set of vertex/fragment shader if
member.remarks: This property only works for glTF 1.0

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GltfSaveOptions.ExternalDracoEncoder
member.summary: Use external draco encoder to accelerate the draco compression speed.
member.remarks: Aspose.3D will create new sub process to encode the mesh to the draco format, use it at your own risk.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GltfSaveOptions.FlipTexCoordV
member.summary: Flip texture coordinate v(t) component, default value is true.

member.summary: The file name of the external buffer file used to store binary data. If this file is not specified, Aspose.3D will generate a name for you. This is ignored when export glTF in binary mode.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.PdfRenderMode
member.summary: Render mode specifies the style in which the 3D artwork is rendered.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.PdfRenderMode.Solid
member.summary: Displays textured and lit geometric shapes.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.PdfRenderMode.SolidWireframe
member.summary: Displays textured and lit geometric shapes (triangles) with single color edges on top of them.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.PdfRenderMode.Transparent
member.summary: Displays textured and lit geometric shapes (triangles) with an added level of transparency.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.PdfRenderMode.TransparentWireframe
member.summary: Displays textured and lit geometric shapes (triangles) with an added level of transparency, with single color opaque edges on top of it.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.PdfRenderMode.BoundingBox
member.summary: Displays the bounding box edges of each node, aligned with the axes of the local coordinate space for that node.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.PdfRenderMode.TransparentBoundingBox
member.summary: Displays bounding boxes faces of each node, aligned with the axes of the local coordinate space for that node, with an added level of transparency.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.PdfRenderMode.TransparentBoundingBoxOutline
member.summary: Displays bounding boxes edges and faces of each node, aligned with the axes of the local coordinate space for that node, with an added level of transparency.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.PdfRenderMode.Wireframe
member.summary: Displays only edges in a single color.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.PdfRenderMode.ShadedWireframe
member.summary: Displays only edges, though interpolates their color between their two vertices and applies lighting.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.PdfRenderMode.HiddenWireframe
member.summary: Displays edges in a single color, though removes back-facing and obscured edges.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.PdfRenderMode.Vertices
member.summary: Displays only vertices in a single color.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.PdfRenderMode.ShadedVertices
member.summary: Displays only vertices, though uses their vertex color and applies lighting.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.PdfRenderMode.Illustration
member.summary: Displays silhouette edges with surfaces, removes obscured lines.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.PdfRenderMode.SolidOutline
member.summary: Displays silhouette edges with lit and textured surfaces, removes obscured lines.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.PdfRenderMode.ShadedIllustration
member.summary: Displays silhouette edges with lit and textured surfaces and an additional emissive term to remove poorly lit areas of the artwork.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.PdfLightingScheme
member.summary: LightingScheme specifies the lighting to apply to 3D artwork.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.PdfLightingScheme.Artwork
member.summary: Uses the lights defined in the scene

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.PdfLightingScheme.None
member.summary: No lights are used.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.PdfLightingScheme.White
member.summary: Three blue-grey infinite lights, no ambient term

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.PdfLightingScheme.Day
member.summary: Three light-grey infinite lights, no ambient term

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.PdfLightingScheme.Night
member.summary: One yellow, one aqua, and one blue infinite light, no ambient term

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.PdfLightingScheme.Hard
member.summary: Three grey infinite lights, moderate ambient term

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.PdfLightingScheme.Primary
member.summary: One red, one green, and one blue infinite light, no ambient term

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.PdfLightingScheme.Blue
member.summary: Three blue infinite lights, no ambient term

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.PdfLightingScheme.Red
member.summary: Three red infinite lights, no ambient term

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.PdfLightingScheme.Cube
member.summary: Six grey infinite lights aligned with the major axes, no ambient term

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.PdfLightingScheme.CAD
member.summary: Three grey infinite lights and one light attached to the camera, no ambient term

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.PdfLightingScheme.Headlamp
member.summary: Single infinite light attached to the camera, low ambient term

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Discreet3dsSaveOptions.DuplicatedNameSeparator
member.summary:
The separator between object's name and the duplicated counter, default value is "_".
When scene contains objects that use the same name, Aspose.3D 3DS exporter will generate a different name for the object. For example there's two nodes named "Box", the first node will have a name "Box", and the second node will get a new name "Box_2" using the default configuration.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Discreet3dsSaveOptions.DuplicatedNameCounterBase
member.summary: The counter used by generating new name for duplicated names, default value is 2.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Discreet3dsSaveOptions.DuplicatedNameCounterFormat
member.summary: The format of the duplicated counter, default value is empty string.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Discreet3dsSaveOptions.MasterScale
member.summary: Gets or sets the master scale used in exporting.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Discreet3dsSaveOptions.GammaCorrectedColor
member.summary: A 3ds file may contains original color and gamma corrected color for same attribute, Setting this to true will use the gamma corrected color if possible, otherwise the Aspose.3D will try to use the original color.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Discreet3dsSaveOptions.FlipCoordinateSystem
member.summary: Gets or sets flip coordinate system of control points/normal during importing/exporting.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Discreet3dsSaveOptions.HighPreciseColor
member.summary: If this is true, the generated 3ds file will use high precise color, means each channel of red/green/blue are in 32bit float. Otherwise the generated file will use 24bit color, each channel use 8bit byte. The default value is false, because not all applications supports the high-precise color.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.License
member.summary: Provides methods to license the component.

member.name: M:Aspose.ThreeD.License.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class.

member.name: M:Aspose.ThreeD.License.SetLicense(System.String)
member.summary: Licenses the component.

remarks.p: Tries to find the license in the following locations:

ms.p: 2. The folder that contains the Aspose component assembly.
3. The folder that contains the client's calling assembly.
4. The folder that contains the entry (startup) assembly.
5. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.
Note:On the .NET Compact Framework, tries to find the license only in these locations:
2. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.

java.p: 2. The folder that contains the Aspose component JAR file.
3. The folder that contains the client's calling JAR file.

member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains
the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As License = New License license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic")
the component jar file:
License license = new License(); license.setLicense("MyLicense.lic"); Can be a full or short file name or name of an embedded resource. Use an empty string to switch to evaluation mode.

member.name: M:Aspose.ThreeD.License.SetLicense(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Licenses the component.
member.param: A stream that contains the license.

remarks.p: Use this method to load a license from a stream.

However, if always fail to upload consumption data and exceed 24 hours, the license will be set to evaluation status, to avoid such case, you should regularly check the license status, if it is evaluation status, call this API again.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Node
member.summary: Represents an element in the scene graph. A scene graph is a tree of Node objects. The tree management services are self contained in this class. Note the Aspose.3D SDK does not test the validity of the constructed scene graph. It is the responsibility of the caller to make sure that it does not generate cyclic graphs in a node hierarchy. Besides the tree management, this class defines all the properties required to describe the position of the object in the scene. This information include the basic Translation, Rotation and Scaling properties and the more advanced options for pivots, limits, and IK joints attributes such the stiffness and dampening. When it is first created, the Node object is "empty" (i.e: it is an object without any graphical representation that only contains the position information). In this state, it can be used to represent parents in the node tree structure but not much more. The normal use of this type of objects is to add them an entity that will specialize the node (see the "Entity"). The entity is an object in itself and is connected to the the Node. This also means that the same entity can be shared among multiple nodes. Camera, Light, Mesh, etc... are all entities and they all derived from the base class Entity.

member.summary: A scene is a top-level object that contains the nodes, geometries, materials, textures, animation, poses, sub-scenes and etc. Scene can have sub-scenes, acts as multiple-document support in files like collada/blender/fbx Node hierarchy can be accessed through is used to keep a reference of unattached objects during serialization(like meta data or custom objects) so it can be used as a library.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Transform
member.summary: A transform contains information that allow access to object's translate/scale/rotation or transform matrix at minimum cost This is used by local transform.
member.seealso: Tutorial - Rotate geometry in a scene

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Transform.GeometricTranslation
member.summary: Gets or sets the geometric translation. Geometric transformation only affects the entities attached and leave the child nodes unaffected. It will be merged as local transformation when you export the geometric transformation to file types that does not support it.

example.code: Node node = new Node(); node.Transform.GeometricTranslation = new Vector3(10, 0, 0);

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Transform.GeometricScaling
member.summary: Gets or sets the geometric scaling. Geometric transformation only affects the entities attached and leave the child nodes unaffected. It will be merged as local transformation when you export the geometric transformation to file types that does not support it.

example.code: Node node = new Node(); node.Transform.GeometricScaling = new Vector3(2, 2, 2);

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Transform.GeometricRotation
member.summary: Gets or sets the geometric Euler rotation(measured in degree). Geometric transformation only affects the entities attached and leave the child nodes unaffected. It will be merged as local transformation when you export the geometric transformation to file types that does not support it.

example.code: Node node = new Node(); node.getTransform().setGeometricRotation(new Vector3(90, 0, 0));

member.name: M:Aspose.ThreeD.Transform.SetGeometricTranslation(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the geometric translation. Geometric transformation only affects the entities attached and leave the child nodes unaffected. It will be merged as local transformation when you export the geometric transformation to file types that does not support it.

example.code: Node node = new Node(); node.Transform.SetGeometricTranslation(10, 0, 0);

member.name: M:Aspose.ThreeD.Transform.SetGeometricScaling(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the geometric scaling. Geometric transformation only affects the entities attached and leave the child nodes unaffected. It will be merged as local transformation when you export the geometric transformation to file types that does not support it.

example.code: Node node = new Node(); node.Transform.SetGeometricScaling(2, 2, 2);

member.name: M:Aspose.ThreeD.Transform.SetGeometricRotation(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the geometric Euler rotation(measured in degree). Geometric transformation only affects the entities attached and leave the child nodes unaffected. It will be merged as local transformation when you export the geometric transformation to file types that does not support it.

example.code: Node node = new Node(); node.Transform.SetGeometricRotation(90, 0, 0);

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Transform.Translation
member.summary: Gets or sets the translation

example.code: Node node = new Node(); node.Transform.Translation = new Vector3(10, 0, 0);

member.name: M:Aspose.ThreeD.Transform.SetTranslation(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the translation of current transform.

example.code: Node node = new Node(); node.Transform.SetTranslation(10, 0, 0);

member.name: M:Aspose.ThreeD.Transform.SetScale(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the scale of current transform.

example.code: Node node = new Node(); node.Transform.SetScale(2, 2, 2);

member.name: M:Aspose.ThreeD.Transform.SetEulerAngles(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the Euler angles in degrees of current transform.

example.code: Node node = new Node(); node.Transform.SetEulerAngles(90, 0, 0);

member.name: M:Aspose.ThreeD.Transform.SetRotation(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the rotation(as quaternion components) of current transform.

example.code: Node node = new Node(); node.Transform.SetRotation(1, 0, 0, 0);

member.summary: Sets the pre-rotation represented in degree

example.code: Node node = new Node(); node.Transform.SetPreRotation(90, 0, 0);

member.summary: Sets the post-rotation represented in degree

example.code: Node node = new Node(); node.Transform.SetPostRotation(90, 0, 0);

member.summary: Gets or sets the scaling offset

member.summary: Material for blinn-phong shading model.
member.seealso: Tutorial - Create a sphere with a Phong material

member.summary: Gets or sets the specular color.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Shading.PhongMaterial.SpecularFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the specular factor. The formula of specular: SpecularColor * SpecularFactor * (N dot H) ^ Shininess

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Shading.PhongMaterial.Shininess
member.summary: Gets or sets the shininess, this controls the specular highlight's size. The formula of specular: SpecularColor * SpecularFactor * (N dot H) ^ Shininess

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Shading.ShaderMaterial
member.summary: A shader material allows to describe the material by external rendering engine or shader language. uses to describe the concrete rendering details, and the most suitable one will be used according to the final rendering platform. For example, your instance can have two technique, one is defined by HLSL, and another is defined by GLSL Under non-window platform the GLSL should be used instead of HLSL

member.summary: Use anisotropic interpolation for sampling, this is only used by minification filter.
